Dear Zara Customer Service,

I am writing to formally raise a complaint regarding my recent order. I wish to return the item in accordance with my consumer rights; however, I have been informed that a home collection is required as the item is large, after 3 attempts of trying to get a label sent via your agents on what’s app no courier has has arrived - this is ongoing now for 2 weeks and the window to return the item is closing. 

Under the Consumer Contracts Regulations 2013, consumers have the right to return goods purchased online within 14 days of receipt for a full refund, including the cost of standard delivery. While retailers may set return methods, these must be fair and reasonable. Forcing a home collection, particularly when alternative return options exist, may not align with these legal requirements.

I kindly request that Zara provide a return option that is both reasonable and compliant with consumer law. If this issue is not resolved satisfactorily, I will have no choice but to escalate my complaint to Trading Standards and seek further advice from Citizens Advice UK.

Please confirm how you will proceed with my return at your earliest convenience.
